DataElement.preferredDefinition: The kind of tube used to collect the sample(s) taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Any device or component shaped like a hollow cylinder.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:Any device or component shaped like a hollow cylinder.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Any device or component shaped like a hollow cylinder.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/22/16 tt, released. 11/10/16 tt, created for specimen tracking and the ETCTN Tissue Acquisition protocol.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube designed to be filled and then thrown away.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube designed to be filled and then thrown away.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Green/Gray Tiger Top Plasma Separation Tube

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Green/Gray Tiger Top Plasma Separation Tube
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube with lithium heparin and a gel, used for plasma determinations in chemistry.

Concepts.longName: Green/Gray Tiger Top Plasma Separation Tube
Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube with lithium heparin and a gel, used for plasma determinations in chemistry.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Red/Gray Tiger Top Serum Separator Tube

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Red/Gray Tiger Top Serum Separator Tube
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube with a coagulant and a gel, used for serum determinations in chemistry.

Concepts.longName: Red/Gray Tiger Top Serum Separator Tube
Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube with a coagulant and a gel, used for serum determinations in chemistry.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Red/Light Gray Tiger Top Secondary Collection Tube

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Red/Light Gray Tiger Top Secondary Collection Tube
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube with no additives, used as a secondary specimen tube.

Concepts.longName: Red/Light Gray Tiger Top Secondary Collection Tube
Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube with no additives, used as a discard tube or secondary specimen tube.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains a gel that separates blood cells from serum.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains a gel that separates blood cells from serum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains a coagulant, designed for the collection of serum.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains a coagulant, designed for the collection of serum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to isolation of cellular RNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol Na, atomic number 11, and atomic weight 23.: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Na, atomic number 11, and atomic weight 23.

A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol Li, atomic number 3, and atomic weight 6.941.: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.: Of comparatively little physical weight or density.: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Li, atomic number 3, and atomic weight 6.941.

A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.
Of comparatively little physical weight or density.

The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue is that of the emerald or somewhat less yellow than that of growing grass.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

Concepts.definition: The acid form of edetate, a chelating agent with anti-hypercalcemic and anticoagulant properties. Edetic acid binds calcium and heavy metal ions, forming soluble stable complexes which are readily excreted by the kidneys. This results in a decrease in serum calcium levels. This agent is also used as an anticoagulant for blood specimens and is applied as a treatment of lead poisoning.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.13 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.: The act or process of making something ready.: Any device or component shaped like a hollow cylinder.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
The act or process of making something ready.
Any device or component shaped like a hollow cylinder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solution of citric acid, sodium citrate, and dextrose used as an anticoagulant in the collection and preservation of whole blood.: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between orange and green, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 570 to 590 nanometers; any of a group of colors of a hue resembling that of ripe lemons and varying in lightness and saturation.

Concepts.definition: A solution of citric acid, sodium citrate, and dextrose used as an anticoagulant in the collection and preservation of whole blood.

The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between orange and green, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 570 to 590 nanometers; any of a group of colors of a hue resembling that of ripe lemons and varying in lightness and saturation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube with a formaldehyde-free preservative which stabilizes nucleated blood cells, preventing the release of genomic DNA, and allowing isolation of high-quality cell-free DNA.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube with a formaldehyde-free preservative which stabilizes nucleated blood cells, preventing the release of genomic DNA, and allowing isolation of high-quality cell-free DNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains a gel that separates blood cells from serum.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains a gel that separates blood cells from serum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains a gel that separates blood cells from serum.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains a gel that separates blood cells from serum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An alkali metal with atomic number 11, atomic weight 23, atomic symbol Na and is used in the manufacture of esters, and preparation of organic compounds, including medicinals.  The ion form is involved in many physiologic preocesses, including blood pressure regulation and electrolyte balance.: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Na, atomic number 11, and atomic weight 23.

A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol Li, atomic number 3, and atomic weight 6.941.: A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Li, atomic number 3, and atomic weight 6.941.

A sulfur-rich glycosaminoglycan with anticoagulant property. Heparin binds to antithrombin III to form a heparin-antithrombin III complex. The complex binds to and irreversibly inactivates thrombin and other activated clotting factors, such as factors IX, X, XI, and XII, thereby preventing the polymerization of fibrinogen to fibrin and the subsequent formation of clots.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary blood collection tube designed for venous blood collection, containing EDTA anticoagulant and a cell preservative. The EDTA absorbs calcium ions, which prevents the blood from clotting. The preservative preserves the morphology and cell surface antigen expression of the epithelial cells and leukocytes. This blood collection tube has been used for the preservation of circulating tumor cells and lymphocyte subsets.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary blood collection tube designed for venous blood collection, containing EDTA anticoagulant and a cell preservative. The EDTA absorbs calcium ions, which prevents the blood from clotting. The preservative preserves the morphology and cell surface antigen expression of the epithelial cells and leukocytes. This blood collection tube has been used for the preservation of circulating tumor cells and lymphocyte subsets.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An evacuated blood collection tube containing K2-EDTA, designed to work as an anti-coagulant.

Concepts.definition: An evacuated blood collection tube containing K2-EDTA, designed to work as an anti-coagulant.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specimen processing tube that is used to separate nucleated cells from the plasma and red blood cell fractions in a whole blood sample based on density.

Concepts.definition: A specimen processing tube that is used to separate nucleated cells from the plasma and red blood cell fractions in a whole blood sample based on density.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary blood collection tube for stabilization and isolation of total RNA from whole blood for gene expression analysis. When blood is drawn into the tube and mixed with the proprietary stabilizing reagent, lysis occurs almost immediately. The stabilizing reagent inactivates cellular RNases and selectively precipitates RNA, with genomic DNA and proteins remaining in solution.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary blood collection tube for stabilization and isolation of total RNA from whole blood for gene expression analysis. When blood is drawn into the tube and mixed with the proprietary stabilizing reagent, lysis occurs almost immediately. The stabilizing reagent inactivates cellular RNases and selectively precipitates RNA, with genomic DNA and proteins remaining in solution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary blood collection tube used in the proprietary Smart Tube blood collection system. that is designed to stabilize whole blood samples for single-cell proteomics. Smart Tube is optimized to work with 1 milliliter of whole blood, proprietary Proteomic Stabilizer and reagents, and a base station that automates the temperature-controlled incubation and stabilization of samples for downstream single-cell analysis.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary blood collection tube used in the proprietary Smart Tube blood collection system. that is designed to stabilize whole blood samples for single-cell proteomics. Smart Tube is optimized to work with 1 milliliter of whole blood, proprietary Proteomic Stabilizer and reagents, and a base station that automates the temperature-controlled incubation and stabilization of samples for downstream single-cell analysis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Complete Blood Count Collection Tube Vacutainer

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Complete Blood Count Collection Tube Vacutainer
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains the anti-coagulant EDTA, designed for complete blood counts and blood films.: A brand of of test tube specifically designed for venipuncture; the tube contains a vacuum allowing it to suck blood though a needle and fill itself. The tube may contain additives to facilitate downstream processing and testing of the blood samples; the tube cap is color-coded to indicate the type of additive present.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains the anti-coagulant EDTA, designed for complete blood counts and blood films.

A brand of of test tube specifically designed for venipuncture; the tube contains a vacuum allowing it to suck blood though a needle and fill itself. The tube may contain additives to facilitate downstream processing and testing of the blood samples; the tube cap is color-coded to indicate the type of additive present.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains a coagulant, designed for the collection of serum.: A brand of of test tube specifically designed for venipuncture; the tube contains a vacuum allowing it to suck blood though a needle and fill itself. The tube may contain additives to facilitate downstream processing and testing of the blood samples; the tube cap is color-coded to indicate the type of additive present.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains a coagulant, designed for the collection of serum.
